summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Federal Bureau of Prisons Legal Counsel, providing a modified laptop to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell for the sole purpose of reviewing discovery materials in her criminal case. The laptop has been disabled for recording, communication, and gaming capabilities.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center to whom the laptop is being provided for reviewing discovery materials in her criminal case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The signatory of the letter, representing the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is corresponding with the BOP regarding the provision of a laptop to Maxwell, the defendant in a case prosecuted by her office.

events.title: Provision of Discovery Laptop to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office provides a specially modified laptop to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC for reviewing discovery in her criminal case.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office provided a laptop to Ghislaine Maxwell in November 2020 for reviewing discovery in her criminal case.
The laptop was modified to disable all recording capabilities (microphone, camera), communication capabilities (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Ethernet), and game programs.
The laptop was to be used solely for reviewing discovery materials from hard drives provided by the prosecution.
The correspondence indicates the ongoing pre-trial preparation and evidence review in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
